title: If you are in a bad losing streak, do what i did and play supp
body:
Look I know a lot of people want to go Rambo on this game and fuck shit up but lets face it, your not going anywhere doing that.

Go ahed and blame your team or whatever but if you play supp then you are not relying on yourself to break this mental spiral that losing streaks get players into... Let someone else carry, kick back and enjoy the blue screen at the end

replies.body: Except for the fact that supports affect a lot more of the game then many people give them credit for.

yeah but you don't have to cs. you don't need to do damage, you just tank and ward and you save your adc most of the game so i guess they do do a lot more then just chill but compared to top or add or mid they have it easier

everything you just said is either wrong, irrelevant or both.


you have absolutely no idea how powerful the support role is.

It is extremely powerful indeed, yet im not constantly on my toes wondering when to push into an engage or avoid one.
Or wondering that when I am trying to out trade an opponent that im missing half a wave of cs.
Or that after two early deaths that I have been shut down already...

Warding, zoning, peeling and keeping your lane partner alive as he/she trades damage is much more favourable if you need to lay back a bit rather then slow reactions against a zed mid lane.

Besides, hitting someone with a snowball as Nunu and watching your buffed ADC melt their face is very satisfying so long as you keep the pressure on the other opponent.

>yet im not constantly on my toes wondering when to push into an engage or avoid one.

Ummm i'm not sure your playing right then, i'm always looking for engages, even when i am playing Nami/Janna.

I'm nearly always the first into fights even on the squishy champs i use, simply because my aim is to get us a winning fight, not to survive said fight.

Lets say I snare with morgana, hoping to engage but then my lane partner backs because he/she doesn't feel like it is worth it.

I cant engage as a supp unless the ad carry in my lane wants to do so as well, so I don't make the decision in the end to engage yet I find points where I feel it might be good to do so and exploit them.

I guess, but if you had ult in that scenario and went full ham, then the ADC would 9/10 times follow you up.

And outside laning phase, your looking for flash ult's anyway, which is a decent engage.

I mean sure there are time's that it won't make a difference, but those times should be few and far between.

Have you ever played support and done warding wars?

You should a decent chunk of the time (assuming your support-support and not just i'm gonna %%%% around support) have 3+ actives on top of your sightstone/sweeper.

You need to be peeling every single team fight and make sure your actives go in the right places.

You need to have your eye on the map 24/7 to work out if you can go aggressive in lane or not.

You have to keep a track of ward timers on ward's you see placed.

Seriously supporting is more then Tanking and warding.

Hint here's a full build nami game of mine, look at all the actives i have to track along side my Exhaust and abilitys.

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/76725319/200474676?tab=overview

i must say this is quite true in every single way, but also compare that to csing and watching map, warding swell and helping take dragon with teleport and watching for banks. support compared to top lane is a lot easier.

Lol

I play top lane and support (more of a support main but ranked at silver from support isn't a good idea) and support is by far the more involving, and the one where mistakes are punished harder because your generally the lowest level person in the game (example is this: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/81609006/200474676?tab=overview  both supports are the lowest on their teams, and as a note, this game i was short a randuins, had we gone longer i would have had another game full of actives).

Not to mention as top lane you have maybe 2 actives (hydra, Randuins/Locket) ontop of a ward/sweeper which is a lot more simple mechanically.

Watching the map and CSing should be skills that you get to the point where your able to do it automatically, sure as a support your not CSing (relic shield though) but your also trying to make openings in a 2v2 and trying to avoid letting the other support have an opening (the positioning in the 2v2 lane is a lot harder to manage then the positioning up top)

Not to mention, as a support, if your not warding the right areas a winning game can instantly turn against you, and it's never fun to be warding as a squishy Nami/Janna/Sona.

Honestly in a ranked game, unless your not actually full on supporting and are just half assing it, supporting is a lot more complicated then a decent chunk of other roles during the whole game.

this is so very true, you are right in every single way, but have to say it is even in difficulty, because support doesn't have to cs they are lower level and have a hard time, where as a top lamer has to be very picky on the situation, figuring out if its a good time to try and get a trade off, weather the jungle will bank you if you are going in for a trade and also if you go to trade you have pushed lane more, then you have to worry about junglier and tower agro and all that %%%%.. they are both complicated role, but if you want to play a role where cs isn't important and you would rather focus on your team then i guess support is the right way to go, but if you want a tank/ bruiser role then top is the way to go (idk about that now with the new meta and all) but from this whole discussion (btw very nice points you have) we can conclude that both roles and for that matter all roles have their difficulties. :D thank you for opening my eyes to this :D

What if you're on a losing streak..... As support?

That does suck!
describe the patterns you are going through in lane that ends in a loss...
What kind of advantage do your opponents have at 5:00? normally.
How do you get when losing teammates or objectives to your opponents? defeated?

League is every bit the mental game as it is physical, except as a support you are not the major target of your lane opponents who really want to shut down the ad carry
